title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 690.17 - Appellate Division review of committee's recommendation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 690.17 - Appellate Division review of committee's recommendation

State Regulations
(a) If the committee's recommendation is
adverse to the applicant, the applicant may, within 60 days after service of a
copy thereof, petition the Appellate Division, in accordance with rule 9404 of
the Civil Practice Law and Rules, on notice of not less than eight days served
on the committee together with any supporting papers, for an order granting the
application for admission to practice notwithstanding the committee's
recommendation. (b) If the
committee recommends approval of the applicant, that recommendation shall be
reviewed by the Appellate Division. The applicant shall have 60 days from
service of a copy of the committee's recommendation to make whatever submission
to the Appellate Division, on notice to the committee, the applicant deems
appropriate. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
690.17

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
